course.title: Don Quixote and the Art of Reading
course.description: In the beginning was the book. From his library the hidalgo, bent on writing himself into History, sallies forth into a world of actors, storytellers, and readers. How do books come by their power to shape individuals and their world? We read Cervantes' masterpiece alongside seminal Renaissance works his characters and readers knew (Erasmus, Vives, More, Castiglione), and modern studies of reading and print culture.
course.prerequisites: Coursework in Spanish at the 70-, 90-, or 100-level, or permission of the instructor.
course.notes: Conducted in Spanish; an advanced reading knowledge of Spanish is essential. There will be class visits to the Houghton Library of Rare Books and screenings of film versions of the novel. .
